intro: Isoschoenus drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's isoschoenus, is a perennial grass species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its drought tolerance, it is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions.
